title: Part A
stimulusHtml: 1 point(s) earned: For correctly indicating that the direction of the field is INTO the page or in the -z direction.
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

1 point(s) earned: For correctly indicating that the direction of the field is INTO the page or in the -z direction.

The student earns one of the following points:

1 point(s) earned: For correctly indicating that the direction of the field is INTO the page or in the -z direction.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) earned: For stating that the (magnetic) force is perpendicular to the velocity, or the force is centripetal, or an equivalent concept.

Note: The use of the phrase “centripetal force,” without stating its source, earned no credit.

1 point(s) earned: For stating that the (magnetic) force or field changes the direction of the velocity but not the speed, or an equivalent concept.
descriptions:

1 point(s) earned: For stating that the (magnetic) force or field changes the direction of the velocity but not the speed, or an equivalent concept.

The student earns one of the following points:

1 point(s) earned: For stating that the (magnetic) force is perpendicular to the velocity, or the force is centripetal, or an equivalent concept.

Note: The use of the phrase “centripetal force,” without stating its source, earned no credit.

1 point(s) earned: For stating that the (magnetic) force or field changes the direction of the velocity but not the speed, or an equivalent concept.

The student earns two of the following points:

1 point(s) earned: For stating that the (magnetic) force is perpendicular to the velocity, or the force is centripetal, or an equivalent concept.

Note: The use of the phrase “centripetal force,” without stating its source, earned no credit.

1 point(s) earned: For stating that the (magnetic) force or field changes the direction of the velocity but not the speed, or an equivalent concept.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point(s) earned : For a correct expression indicating that the magnetic force provides the centripetal force

mv 2 /R = qvB

1 point(s) earned : For a correct calculation of the radius of the trajectory

R = x /2 = 1.75m/2 = 0.875

1 point(s) earned : For correct substitutions into a correct expression

v = q B R m = 2 ( 1.60 × 10 − 19 C ) ( 0.090 T ) ( 0.875 m ) 1.45 × 10 − 25 kg

1 point(s) earned : For a correct answer with units

v = 1.74 x 10 5 m/s

title: Part D
